item.title: The End of the Road: Why I Finally Stopped Distro Hopping for NixOS
item.description:
The Distro Hopper’s Curse

If you’ve been on Linux for more than a month, you know the feeling. You install Arch because you want the latest packages. Then, something breaks, and you miss the stability of Debian. You try Fedora for a “middle ground,” but then you miss the AUR.

I have spent years in this loop. I thought I was looking for a better desktop environment or a faster package manager. But I was actually looking for NixOS.
